intro: Echinocactus rettigii, commonly known as the Rettig's hedgehog cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of Mexico. It is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems that are typically green to blue-green in color. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, which are clustered at the tips of the stems. It is a slow-growing cactus that thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in desert gardens.
